data.text:
@TeslaAndDoge Oklahoma doesn't want to. 
Backwoods boys.
@TeslaAndDoge Not possible zero . Oil not only used for cars and solar energy is slowly used for everything.
@TeslaAndDoge It’s clear I should have bought near $0 🤦‍♂️
@TeslaAndDoge I know you have the best of intentions, but the way to curtail the Russian/Iranian/Venezuelan threats is for the U.S. to pump more oil, not less.

@TeslaAndDoge The sun is dependable in that it always exists and provides heat, but where I live (near Chicago) we have days or weeks at a time that are overcast or that snow builds up on solar panels.  Thus the efficiency of solar is quite erratic.
@BTCBreadMan Not saying it should be “suddenly” phased out. We just need to quicken the pace of “transition”. BTW, I consider the sun to be way more dependable. It always shows up in the morning 🤷‍♂️

@TeslaAndDoge It isn’t about liking or disliking oil.  I’m just saying that it is an incredibly dependable energy source that, if suddenly phased out in short term, would basically crash entire economies.  Thus we need to be very careful and intentional about how we phase it out of use.
@nyancoinbull The whole world is already powered from the Sun. We should go directly to the source using solar, rather than produce CO2 in the process.
